text: project blue sky inc & ors v australian broadcasting authority  statutes
presumption that provisions intended to achieve consistent goals
grammatical meaning and legal meaning.  statutes
acts done in breach of a condition regulating a statutory power
whether inconsistent with legislative requirement that functions be performed consistently with australia's international obligations.  media law
power to make standards that "relate to ... the australian content of programs"
whether restricted to standards conferring preferential treatment.  trade law

australia new zealand closer economic relations trade agreement.  broadcasting services act 1992 (cth), ss 3 , 122 , 158, 160.  broadcasting services (transitional provisions and consequential amendments) act 1992 (cth), s 21.  tasker v fullwood [1978] 1 nswlr 20 at 23-24 applied.
mortgage and guarantees given to person carrying on unauthorized banking business
where firefighter classifications in award required employees to have completed specified period of "service"
whether specification of a period of "service" in classification relates to service in firefighting, service in firefighting with current employer only, or service with current employer only
whether employer in appointing second respondent to position of leading firefighter breached the award therefore attracting penalties under the workplace relations act 1996 (cth)
"service" held to be service with current employer
second respondent validly appointed to position of leading firefighter
appeal from industrial division of the magistrates' court of victoria to a single judge employment law
contract and certified agreement contained provisions relating to training and termination
contractual provision required payment of a training bond on voluntary termination by employee
priority given to certified agreement in cases of inconsistency costs
s 347 of the workplace relations act 1996 (cth)
whether proceeding issued " vexatiously or without reasonable cause "
